L2_gloss:
bark
ተመንያ ዝረአየስ፣ ብልሕጺ / ብልሕፂ ተደሕለ
(tämän-ya zə-räʾayä-s bə-ləḥṣi tädäḥlä)
The one who has seen a snake is afraid of a bark (i.e. anything that resembles a snake) (proverb) [1]
test; tool used for confirming a pregnancy or an infection
a wild sage, perhaps Salvia aethiopis, Salvia nilotica, or Salvia schimperi
to catch (a ball, a thrown object)
to be infected, to be afflicted (with a sickness)
body; the physical part of a creature (as opposed to the soul)
to miss, to be long for
Australia (a continent and country in Oceania)
from (used to indicate origin or source)
to move (to a new home), to relocate
ear of a plant like corn or sorghum
to weed, to take out the weeds
